question: Gif monnes (tunge) #### biþ of heafde oðres monnes dadum don, gebete him mid .lx. scill — If a man's tongue is struck from the head by another man's deeds, compensate him with 60 shillings

God betæhte þæt mare leoht þæt is seo sunne to þæm dæge ond þæt læsse leoht þæt is se (mona) #### to ðære nihte — God assigned the greater light, that is the sun, to the day, and the lesser light, that is the moon, to the night
Se (cempa) #### oferwon frecnessa fela — The champion overcame many perils
(Culfre) #### is bilewite nyten ond fram geallan biternysse ælfremed — A dove is a meek animal and a stranger to the bitterness of gall

Ac Albanes slaga ne moste gesundful libban forðam þe him burston ut butu his (eage) #### ond to eorðan feollon mid albanes heafde — But Alban's slayer was not allowed to live in health, because both his eyes burst out of him and fell to the earth with Alban’s head
Æt helle duru (draca) #### eardigaþ — Dragon's dwell at hell's door
(eage) #### sind flæscene ond teð bænene — Eyes are of flesh and teeth of bone
Se Halga Gast wæs æteowod ofer Criste on his fulluhte on anre (culfre) #### anlicnysse — The Holy Ghost appears over Christ, at his baptism, in likeness of a dove
Gefyrn scean leoht ingehydes geond þære (eorðe) #### ymbhwyrft — Of old the light of knowledge shone over the circumference of earth

Þonne bið seo sunne be seofonfealdum beorhtre þonne heo nu sy ond se mona hæfð þære (sunne) #### leoht — Then will the sun be sevenfold brighter than it now is, and the moon will have the light of the sun
He ne hierþ nanes (wita) #### word — He didn't hear any advisor's words
Ðu fortrydst leona ond (draca) #### — You shall be a treader down of lions and dragons

Gelyfde an ðara (cempa) ####, ðæs nama wæs Romanus, and cwæð to þæm Godes cyðere, 'Laurentie, ic geseo Godes engel standende ætforan ðe' — One of the soldiers, whose name was Romanus, believed, and said to the martyr of God, 'Lawrence, I see God's angel standing before thee'

Þara (cnapa) #### ðe binnan syxtyne geara ylde wæron hund-nigontig ðusenda hie tosendon to gehwylcum leodscipum to ðeowte — Of boys who were within sixteen years of age, they sent ninety thousand to all nations in slavery
Saulus heold ðara leasra (wita) #### reaf ond heora mod to þære stæninge geornlice tihte — Saul held the garments of the false witnesses, and zealously instigated their minds to the stoning

Ðas ðry dagas wæron buton seo (sunne) #### ond se monan ond þa steorran ond eallum tidum gelicere wægan mid leohte ond þeostrum aðenede — Those three days were without the sun, the moon, the stars and all the hours, stretched out with light and darkness in equal balance
Ða het se casere his (hunta) #### hine ðær gefeccean ond hine mid sweorde ofslean — Then the emperor bade his hunters fetch him there and kill him with a sword
explanation: This is acc pl not acc sing like in the sheet

question: God him sette (nama) #### Adam — God gave him the name Adam
Ða easternan tungelwitegan gesawon niwne (steorra) #### beorhtne — The eastern astronomers saw a new bright star
On þæm ylcan dæge he geworhte ealle (steorra) #### ond tida gesette — On the same day he created all stars and established hours
God gesceop us twa eagan ond twa (eare) #### twa nosðyrlu twegen weleras twa handa ond twegen fet — God gave two eyes and two ears, two nostrils, two lips, two hands and two feet
Ðær wæron gecype (oxa) #### ond scep ond culfran ond þær sæton myneteras — There were oxen, sheep and doves for sale, and there sat moneyers
Ezechias eac asende his (wita) #### mid hæran gescrydde to þæm witegan Isaiam — Hezekiah also sent his counsellors clad in haircloth to the prophet Isaiah
He betæhte lamb to his (cnapa) #### ond se cnapa hit ofsloh — He gave a lamb to his boy and the boy slew it

Gif ic þisum (draca) #### to forswelgenne geseald eom, hwi sceal ic elcunge þrowian for eowerum oferstealle? — If I am given to this dragon to be swallowed, why should I suffer delay through your presence?
Ic ðe ofer (eorþe) #### geworhte, on ðære ðu scealt yrmþum lifgan — I created you on earth, on which you shall live in misery
Ælfred cyning sende þa scipu to þæm (muþe) #### — King Alfred sent the ships to the river-mouth
Abraham ferde mid twam (cnapa) #### to fyrlenum lande — Abraham went with two boys to a distant land
Anhyrne deor þæt deor hæfð ænne horn bufan ðæm twam (eage) #### swa strangne and swa scearpne — A one horned deer, that deer has one horn above the two eyes so strong and so sharp
